topic_metadata.title: How can I keep the indent in a list?

posts.cooked:
When I use displayed equations in a list, the text following the equation will not be indented. For example:

- #lorem(10)
$ x $
#lorem(10)
- #lorem(10)

It looks like:

image768×204 17.7 KB

How can I indent the line following the equation?
posts.raw:
When I use displayed equations in a list, the text following the equation will not be indented. For example:
```
- #lorem(10)
$ x $
#lorem(10)
- #lorem(10)
```
It looks like:
![image|690x183](upload://1ucmJVP0OhiSM2GrtJyipwzA7yR.png)
How can I indent the line following the equation?

posts.name: SillyFreak
posts.cooked:
By writing $ x $ not indented by two spaces (i.e. the same amount as the - ... starting the list) you’re exiting the list and start a new one. You can easily see that by replacing - by + and looking at the numbers.

So the fix is to indent the two lines:

- #lorem(10)
  $ x $
  #lorem(10)
- #lorem(10)

The problem is that the math will now be centered relative to the width of the list item, not of the page, but that can be fixed with a block with width: 100% – see also here:

- #lorem(10)
  #block(width: 100%, $ x $)
  #lorem(10)
- #lorem(10)
posts.raw:
By writing `$ x $` not indented by two spaces (i.e. the same amount as the `- ...` starting the list) you're exiting the list and start a new one. You can easily see that by replacing `-` by `+` and looking at the numbers.

So the fix is to indent the two lines:
```typ
- #lorem(10)
  $ x $
  #lorem(10)
- #lorem(10)
```
The problem is that the math will now be centered relative to the width of the list item, not of the page, but that can be fixed with a block with `width: 100%` -- see also [here](https://forum.typst.app/t/how-to-make-nested-bulleted-lists-where-content-includes-centered-equations/846/3):
```typ
- #lorem(10)
  #block(width: 100%, $ x $)
  #lorem(10)
- #lorem(10)
```

posts.cooked: Thanks! The block is also very useful.
posts.raw: Thanks! The block is also very useful.
